issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

fields.summary: Eucalyptus keeps the previous IPs in VNET_PUBLICIPS even after the field is modified and CC cleanrestarted.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When the IPs in VNET_PUBLICIPS was modified to include a complete different set of new IPs, it was seen that Eucaluptus was giving out IPs that were listed in the previous VNET_PUBLICIPS field.

Steps.

1. List 255 IPs in VNET_PUBLICIPS in eucalyptus.conf
2. Start Eucalytpus
3. Modify the IPs in VNET_PUBLICIPS to be a completely new set of IPs.
4. Clean-restart CC
5. As a user, request 400 IPs
<bash>
for x in {1..400}; do euca-allocate-address; done;
</bash>
fields.summary: Eucalyptus keeps the previous IPs in VNET_PUBLICIPS even after the field is modified and CC cleanrestarted.

comments.body:
Tested this with 3.4.

Before changing the address,
{noformat}
[root@a-27 ~]# euca-describe-addresses verbose
ADDRESS	10.111.101.184	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.185	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.186	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.187	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.196	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.197	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.198	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.199	nobody	standard
{noformat}

Remove the previous address and added new ones in eucalyptus.conf on frontend (CLC/CC/W/SC),
{noformat}
#VNET_PUBLICIPS="10.111.101.184 10.111.101.185 10.111.101.186 10.111.101.187 10.111.101.196 10.111.101.197 10.111.101.198 10.111.101.199"
VNET_PUBLICIPS="10.104.3.128 10.104.3.129"
{noformat}

Restarted eucalyptus-cc (no cleanrestart from 3.3.x).

Checked addresses,
{noformat}
root@a-27 ~]# euca-describe-addresses verbose
ADDRESS	10.104.3.128	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.3.129	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.184	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.185	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.186	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.187	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.196	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.197	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.198	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.111.101.199	nobody	standard
{noformat}

Tried to allocate addresses,
{noformat}
[root@a-27 ~]# euca-allocate-address
ADDRESS	10.104.3.128	standard
[root@a-27 ~]# euca-allocate-address
ADDRESS	10.104.3.129	standard
[root@a-27 ~]# euca-allocate-address
ADDRESS	10.111.101.184	standard
{noformat}

In cloud-output.log,
{noformat}
2013-09-04 08:17:01 DEBUG 000053724 Address                  | Initialized address: Address 10.104.3.128
2013-09-04 08:17:01 DEBUG 000053724 Address                  | Initialized address: Address 10.104.3.129
{noformat}

Installed Packages
{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.1443.20130831gite1de8487.el6
{noformat}

Eucalyptus       Version:	3.3.1
Platform:	        Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.4 (Santiago)
Architecture:	x86_64


A.	Before changing address:

	# euca-describe-addresses 
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.111    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.112    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.113    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.114    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.115    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.116    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.117    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.118    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.119    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.120    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.121    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.122    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.123    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.124    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.125    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.126    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.127    nobody  standard


B.	Remove the previous set and add the following new set of IP address range in eucalyptus.conf (CC); 
	VNET_PUBLICIPS="192.168.1.5-192.168.1.8"

C.	Restart CC;
	service eucalyptus-cc restart

D.	Checked address range;
	
	# euca-describe-addresses 
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.111    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.112    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.113    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.114    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.115    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.116    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.117    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.118    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.119    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.120    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.121    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.122    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.123    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.124    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.125    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.126    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 10.104.3.127    nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 192.168.1.5     nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 192.168.1.6     nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 192.168.1.7     nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 192.168.1.8     nobody  standard

	
E.	Restart CLC;
	service eucalyptus-cloud restart

F.	Checked Addresses;
	# euca-describe-addresses 
	ADDRESS 192.168.1.5     nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 192.168.1.6     nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 192.168.1.7     nobody  standard
	ADDRESS 192.168.1.8     nobody  standard

The fix relates to the network configuration property which is used in all network modes from 4.2.

{code}
#
# euca-describe-addresses verbose | sort
ADDRESS	10.111.31.167	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.168	i-eaa5e697 (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.169	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.170	i-fb28053d (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.171	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.172	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.173	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.174	i-a07185fa (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
#
#
# vi network.json 
#
#
# euca-modify-property -fcloud.network.network_configuration=network.json 
PROPERTY	cloud.network.network_configuration	{
  "Clusters": [
    {
      "Name": "one",
      "PrivateIps": [
        "10.111.31.175",
        "10.111.31.176",
        "10.111.31.177",
        "10.111.31.178",
        "10.111.31.179",
        "10.111.31.180",
        "10.111.31.181",
        "10.111.31.182"
      ],
      "Subnet": {
        "Gateway": "10.111.0.1",
        "Name": "10.111.0.0",
        "Netmask": "255.255.0.0",
        "Subnet": "10.111.0.0"
      }
    }
  ],
  "InstanceDnsServers": [
    "10.111.5.157"
  ],
  "Mode": "EDGE",
  "PublicIps": [
    "10.111.31.170",
    "10.111.31.171",
    "10.111.31.172",
    "10.111.31.173",
    "10.111.31.174"
  ]
} was {
  "Clusters": [
    {
      "Name": "one",
      "PrivateIps": [
        "10.111.31.175",
        "10.111.31.176",
        "10.111.31.177",
        "10.111.31.178",
        "10.111.31.179",
        "10.111.31.180",
        "10.111.31.181",
        "10.111.31.182"
      ],
      "Subnet": {
        "Gateway": "10.111.0.1",
        "Name": "10.111.0.0",
        "Netmask": "255.255.0.0",
        "Subnet": "10.111.0.0"
      }
    }
  ],
  "InstanceDnsServers": [
    "10.111.5.157"
  ],
  "Mode": "EDGE",
  "PublicIps": [
    "10.111.31.167",
    "10.111.31.168",
    "10.111.31.169",
    "10.111.31.170",
    "10.111.31.171",
    "10.111.31.172",
    "10.111.31.173",
    "10.111.31.174"
  ]
}
#
#
# euca-describe-addresses verbose | sort
ADDRESS	10.111.31.167	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.168	i-eaa5e697 (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.169	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.170	i-fb28053d (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.171	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.172	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.173	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.174	i-a07185fa (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
#
#
# euca-describe-addresses verbose | sort
ADDRESS	10.111.31.168	i-eaa5e697 (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.170	i-fb28053d (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.171	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.172	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.173	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.174	i-a07185fa (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
# 
# 
# euca-terminate-instances i-eaa5e697
INSTANCE	i-eaa5e697	running	shutting-down
# 
# 
# euca-describe-addresses verbose | sort
ADDRESS	10.111.31.170	i-fb28053d (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.171	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.172	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.173	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.111.31.174	i-a07185fa (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard	
#
#
{code}

There is a short delay between updating the network configuration and the new configuration being applied during which you will still see the old public IPs.

Public IPs that are in use as system assigned public addresses or EIP allocations will be retained until those IPs are no longer in use (a cloud administrator can re-assign public IPs as necessary)

Fix Verified.
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.2.0
Release     : 0.0.24027.708.20151012gitd90b229.el6
Changes to IP addresses in network config are reflected very quickly.

Change address range:
{code}
[root@g-05-07 ~]# euca-modify-property -fcloud.network.network_configuration=network.json
warning: euca-modify-property is deprecated; use ``euctl'' instead
PROPERTY	cloud.network.network_configuration	{
  "Clusters": [
    {
      "Name": "one",
      "PrivateIps": [
        "10.111.50.0-10.111.50.100"
      ],
      "Subnet": {
        "Gateway": "10.111.0.1",
        "Name": "10.111.0.0",
        "Netmask": "255.255.0.0",
        "Subnet": "10.111.0.0"

    "10.111.5.167"
  ],
  "Mode": "EDGE",
  "PublicIps": [
    "10.111.50.101-10.111.50.111"
  ]
} was {
  "Clusters": [
    {
      "Name": "one",
      "PrivateIps": [
        "10.111.50.0-10.111.50.100"
{
      ],
      "Subnet": {
        "Gateway": "10.111.0.1",
        "Name": "10.111.0.0",
        "Netmask": "255.255.0.0",
        "Subnet": "10.111.0.0"

  ],
  "Mode": "EDGE",
  "PublicIps": [
    "10.111.50.101-10.111.50.200"
  ]
}
{code}
